alert.note: Alert for Jack; Palo Pinto; Parker; Stephens; Tarrant; Wise; Young (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 9:16PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Young, southern Wise, Jack, Parker, northwestern Tarrant, northeastern Stephens and northern Palo Pinto Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 914 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking outflow winds out ahead of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Olney to Briar. Movement was south at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Weatherford, Mineral Wells, Azle, Graham, Decatur, Bridgeport, Jacksboro, Olney, Briar, Pecan Acres, Willow Park, Reno, Aledo, Springtown, Brock, Hudson Oaks, Western Lake, Pelican Bay, Annetta, and New Fairview. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 between mile markers 394 and 423. Interstate 30 near mile marker 1. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Possum Kingdom Lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.

area.areaDesc: Jack; Palo Pinto; Parker; Stephens; Tarrant; Wise; Young
